COMMENT_TX: $Carl Furillo threw his bat at Sal Maglie after the 2nd pitch; Furillo was restrained by Sal Yvars
$Gil Hodges was trapped between 2B and 3B and Dick Williams ran to 2B; they two runners arrived almost simultaneously; Williams was tagged before reaching the bag and then Hodges was put out
to match daily/TSN, arbitrary K to K23
$Jackie Robinson left with a sore side
$Max Surkont dropped the ball after making lunging tag

ej,stane101,M,conlj102,Obstruction call ej,riced101,P,conlj102,Obstruction call (Threw glove) $Solly Hemus dove to his right for the hard-hit grounder; $Jackie Robinson fell over Hemus as he sprawled in the base path; 3B umpire Tom Gorman ruled obstruction on Hemus and allowed Robinson to score; Del Rice ran to 3B to argue with Gorman and Cardinals Manager Eddie Stanky tried to get between them; Rice and Stanky ejected by HP umpire Jocko Conlan; Stanky played the game under protest for what he called a 'misinterpretation of the rules;' no error was charged to Hemus
ej,hermb101,C,warnl101,Checked swing Dodgers Coach Billy Herman ejected by HP umpire Lon Warneke
ej,jonew101,P,warnl101,Call at 3B Willie Jones ejected by 3B umpire Lon Warneke
to match daily/TSN, arbitrary K to K23

ej,dunlg102,P,gorea901,Call at 2B Grant Dunlap ejected by 2B umpire Artie Gore
$Al Worthington threw at Jackie Robinson and Roy Campanella; both teams were warned

ej,campr102,P,donaa901,Catch/no catch call $Roy Campanella caught a foul ball in the Giants box seats near their bench but HP umpire Augie Donatelli ruled that a fan touched it; that person was a guest of the Giants owner; Campanella ejected by Donatelli
$Peewee Reese reached 3B on the error but was sent back to 2B by the umpires because the ball rolled under the tarp

ej,stane101,M,conlj102,Obstruction call ej,riced101,P,conlj102,Obstruction call (Threw glove) $Solly Hemus dove to his right for the hard-hit grounder; $Jackie Robinson fell over Hemus as he sprawled in the base path; 3B umpire Tom Gorman ruled obstruction on Hemus and allowed Robinson to score; Del Rice ran to 3B to argue with Gorman and Cardinals Manager Eddie Stanky tried to get between them; Rice and Stanky ejected by HP umpire Jocko Conlan; Stanky played the game under protest for what he called a 'misinterpretation of the rules;' no error was charged to Hemus
